body: I don't think there is any common overload, so we'll need to use #if.

@oznetmaster It's a trivial bug, but a good way for you to work all the way through our process and see how it works. Normally, one of us would probably just fix this directly in master, but as an exercise for you, let's do it with a branch, PR and review.

issue.title: Add CF to the Appveyor CI build

milestone.description: A bugfix release with a few new features.

issue.body: As indicated by #331 we keep breaking the compact framework build without realizing it. We need to at least compile it in our CI and if possible run the tests. Without installing a bunch of stuff in Appveyor, we'll probably only be able to run it using assembly unification under desktop .NET for now.

body:
There is.  The WaitOne (delay, exitContext) exists in all platforms:

.NET Framework

Supported in: 3.5, 3.0, 2.0, 1.1, 1.0

.NET Compact Framework

Supported in: 3.5, 2.0

XNA Framework

Supported in: 2.0, 1.0

issue.title: Issue 334
issue.body:
This PR adds file-related assertions and constraints to the NUnitLite builds that support it - all but Silverlight - thereby fixing #334.

It also fixes the small critical error documented by #331 

It was also convenient to add FileAssert and DirectoryAssert to the non-Silverlight NUnitLite builds at the same time, which is a partial fix for #335.

issue.title: Getting CF framework unit tests running on CI build

milestone.description: A bugfix release with a few new features.

issue.body:
from #1305  

New issue for getting the unit tests running on Compact framework.

Two suggestions to fix.
1. Getting an emulator running some how to run the tests on a device
2. relaxing the rules so we will execute the CF framework code on windwos

There is 10 failing tests, listed below, some of them don't look platform related. But haven't had a detailed look yet.

Errors and Failures

1) Failed : NUnit.Framework.Api.TestAssemblyRunnerTests.Load_BadFile_ReturnsNonRunnableSuite
  Expected: String starting with "File or assembly name" and containing "mock-assembly.pdb"
  But was:  "Could not load file or assembly 'mock-assembly.pdb' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified."

  But was:  "Could not load file or assembly 'file:///D:\SOURCE\Repos\nunit\bin\Release\netcf-3.5\junk.dll' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified."
